body.p:
Eddyville Ky February 20, 1864
Mr Grant Green
Sir. I enclose to you address a Petition for an old friend of our county and one of your old democratic constituents

The facts stated in the petition I know to be true, since I defended him and they were proven on his trial as alledged in the Petition. I am a stranger to the Governor and for that reason have not enclosed it to him directly,, I hope you will present the Petition to him and give me such assistance as the character of case requires. Let me hear from you soon,, And by so doing I will be placed under lasting obligations to you
P. S. Pleas to urge the weather immediately before the Gov. since executions are out & the officer is urging Asbridge up to settlement
